item.title: Kitty add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "Human beings are the only creatures that allow their children to come back home." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I never think of the future - it comes soon enough." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Tom Hanks
item.description: "I'm glad I didn't have to fight in any war. I'm glad I didn't have to pick up a gun. I'm glad I didn't get killed or kill somebody. I hope my kids enjoy the same lack of manhood." -- Tom Hanks

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special." -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Kitty add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Our problems are manmade--therefore, they can be solved by man. And man can be as big as he wants. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings. Man's reason and spirit have often solved the seemingly unsolvable--and we believe they can do it again." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Kitty add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "You can't deny laughter; when it comes, it plops down in your favorite chair and stays as long as it wants." -- Stephen King
